entry.name: SabreMannedLoaderDescription
entry.value: When more than one cargo slot is filled, increase attacks and melee damage reduction. When more than two cargo slots are filled, increase accuracy and melee damage reduction.

entry.name: SabreMannedLoaderFlavor
entry.value: While gunners can load weapons on their own, having a loading crew to handle ammo and barrel maintenance allows them to focus on continuing to lay down fire. Loaders also double as security, as they can deliver suppressing fire upon any approaching enemies from the ground.

entry.name: SabreFullyManned1Description
entry.value: Requires 3 or more cargo to be fired.

entry.name: SabreFullyManned1Flavor
entry.value: More weapons require more hands, even when they're all pointed in the same direction. In the Imperium, ammo doesn't load itself; the God-Emperor gifted Man with a high population for a reason.

entry.name: SabreGroundAimDescription
entry.value: When attacking vehicles, gain armour penetration and damage. Reduced accuracy against Flyers, Jetpacks, Jetbikes, and Skimmers.

entry.name: SabreGroundAimFlavor
entry.value: To be mounted on a swivelable platform, twin-linked lascannons have a reduced core charge to prevent excessive overheating. However, specialised heavy barrels can be installed to improve effectiveness against armour. Much to the chagrin of the Adeptus Mechanicus, it is unknown why these barrels have no change in effect against flesh. In addition, the weight of these barrels makes it more difficult to swing the weapon around, making it harder to aim against agile foes.
